IOT.IOTApplication.alarmclock

Class ACRestService

  • java.lang.Object
    • IOT.IOTApplication.alarmclock.ACRestService

  • @Path(value="/acrestservice/")
public class ACRestService
extends java.lang.Object
    AlarmClockRESTService - This class offers an API to the user to get all available alarms or one specific alarm, create a new one and delete a previously created one through a REST Client. The service is available at '/acrestservice/' and the corresponding path following.
    Version:
    Milestone2
    Author:
    Peter Klosowski a1403029

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ACRestService(AlarmClockService newAcs)
      Constructor connecting the Alarm Clock Service to the REST Service to get, remove and update the latest alarms.

      javax.ws.rs.core.Response delElement(java.lang.String msDate)
      DELETE method to remove a previously added alarm.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAllElements()
      For GET there are two APIs supported - /getalarms returns an HTTP response with a JSON string that includes an array filled with created alarms as dates in milliseconds through a GET request.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getElement(java.lang.String msDate)
      For GET there are two APIs supported - /getalarm/{msdate} returns an HTTP response with a JSON string that includes an array filled with this alarm as date in milliseconds and if it has been started through a GET request.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response postElement(java.lang.String msDate)
      POST method available at /postalarm to create and start a new alarm.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllElements

        @GET
 @Path(value="/getalarms")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
 @Consumes(value={"application/json","application/x-www-form-urlencoded"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAllElements()
        For GET there are two APIs supported - /getalarms returns an HTTP response with a JSON string that includes an array filled with created alarms as dates in milliseconds through a GET request.
        Returns:
        HTTP Response - 404 if ACS wasn't started yet, else JSON rendition of available alarms.

      • getElement

        @GET
 @Path(value="/getalarm/{msdate}")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
 @Consumes(value={"application/json","application/x-www-form-urlencoded"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getElement(@PathParam(value="msdate")
                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.String msDate)
        For GET there are two APIs supported - /getalarm/{msdate} returns an HTTP response with a JSON string that includes an array filled with this alarm as date in milliseconds and if it has been started through a GET request.
        Parameters:
        msDate - Date in milliseconds
        Returns:
        HTTP Response - 400 if passed date isn't a number, 404 if alarm wasn't found, else 200 with JSON rendition of available alarms.

      • postElement

        @POST
 @Path(value="/postalarm")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
 @Consumes(value={"application/json","application/x-www-form-urlencoded"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response postElement(@FormParam(value="msdate")
                                                                                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String msDate)
        POST method available at /postalarm to create and start a new alarm. The parameter 'msdate' needs to be passed in a form and represents a millisecond rendition of the date that will be added.
        Parameters:
        msDate - Date in milliseconds
        Returns:
        400 if alarm was already added, in the past or couldnt be started, else 201 with alarm location in header.

      • delElement

        @DELETE
 @Path(value="/delalarm")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
 @Consumes(value={"application/json","application/x-www-form-urlencoded"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response delElement(@FormParam(value="msdate")
                                                                                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String msDate)
        DELETE method to remove a previously added alarm. The parameter 'msdate' needs to be passed in a form and represents a millisecond rendition of the date that will be removed.
        Parameters:
        msDate - Date in milliseconds
        Returns:
        HTTP Response - 400 if passed date isn't a number, 404 if alarm wasn't found, else 200.
